title: 109_s1028
content: The Act titled "Military Personnel Financial Services Education Act of 2005" requires consumer education for members of the armed forces and their spouses on insurance and other financial services. The "Military Personnel Financial Services Education Act of 2005" mandates a consumer education program for armed forces members on various financial services available to them, including those offered by private sector sources. The "Military Personnel Financial Services Education Act of 2005" requires financial training for members at military installations, including information on prevalent financial services marketing practices. Counseling on financial services is also mandated for each member and spouse. The "Military Personnel Financial Services Education Act of 2005" mandates financial counseling for members and their spouses at military installations. Counseling is provided by full-time financial services counselors at installations with at least 750 members, and through appropriate mechanisms at other installations. The Secretary ensures counseling on financial services is provided by qualified individuals at military installations, including members of the armed forces or Federal Government employees. The Secretary ensures that financial services counselors and individuals providing counseling are free from conflicts of interest and dedicated to providing helpful information to members of the armed forces and their spouses. Financial services counseling can be provided by unit personnel under the guidance of qualified counselors. Life insurance counseling is also included in the services offered to members of the armed forces and their spouses. The curr_chunk discusses the requirement for members of the armed forces or their spouses to receive information on Servicemembers' Group Life Insurance. It also states that payment for private sector life insurance cannot be authorized through a pay allotment without written certification from a commander or financial services counselor. The curr_chunk discusses the requirement for members of the armed forces to receive counseling on purchasing private sector life insurance, with a 7-day waiting period for authorization of pay allotment. Commanders can waive this requirement for valid reasons, such as imminent change of station. The curr_chunk defines "covered member of the armed forces" as grades E-1 through E-4 and includes life insurance, casualty insurance, and investments in securities under the term "financial services." A clerical amendment is also made to the table of sections. The amendments to section 992 of title 10, United States Code, regarding consumer education in financial services, will not affect any existing pay allotments authorized by members of the Armed Forces before the effective date of the section. The amendments will take effect more than 120 days after the enactment of the Act.
